alert.note: Alert for Flathead, Mission Valleys; Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 11:10AM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A very heavy rain shower will impact portions of central Missoula and south central Lake Counties through 1145 AM MDT... At 1107 AM MDT, trained weather spotters reported a very heavy rain shower over Wye, or near Missoula, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Visibility one-half mile or less. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Low visibility could result in dangerous driving conditions. Locations impacted include... Missoula, Wye, and Evaro. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 90 and 103. Highway 93 N between mile markers 0 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Flathead, Mission Valleys; Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region
